page.title: 10THE MANOR HOUSE IN BOOTHBY
page.content: The Norman Manor House in Boothby is the oldest and most complete building of its kind in England.It was built in 1180 of Lincolnshire Limestone and its roof is made of Collyweston Slate.It is 25 feet by 56 feet.To the west of the manor the moat.The ground floor consists of 2 cellars.Animals were kept in one and wine was made and stored in the other.A flight of stone steps lead up to the first floor which was originally one room.In Tudor times a wall and screen were installed to make more rooms,and an extention was built.The ceiling was lowered to make an attic for the servants. Now the manor is not lived in as Boothby Hall was built in the 1630s.
